$AAPL $FB $PYPL

Moody's Upgrades $AAPL to Top Credit Rating Alongside Microsoft, Johnson & JohnsonMT 

Moody's said Tuesday it upgraded Apple's senior unsecured long-term credit rating to Aaa from Aa1 with a stable outlook.

The rating elevates Apple the top of the agency's ratings scale alongside $MSFT and Johnson & Johnson ($JNJ).

Moody's cited the iPhone maker's "exceptional" liquidity and "robust" earnings, alongside a "very strong" business profile.

Moody's expects average operating income growth in mid-single digits over the next 12 to 24 months, buoyed by growth in iPhone, services and wearables categories. Revenue gains and profitability are expected to primarily hinge on iPhone sales despite ongong diversification into services, according to the agency.

"Apple's ecosystem of products and services provides enhanced revenue visibility over time despite some level of volatility that is inherent in its business from product introduction cycles," Moody's analyst Raj Joshi said in a note.
